items.item_text: 4:30 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at the District Board Room, 4750 San Felipe Road, San Jose, CA 95135.
items.item_text_raw: 1. 4:30 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at the District Board Room, 4750 San Felipe Road, San Jose, CA 95135.

items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
A public hearing is opened to allow an opportunity for public  input regarding the 2014-2015 contract re-opener proposal submitted by the San Jose/Evergreen Federation of Teachers, AFT 6157 at the July 8, 2014, meeting of Board.  The openers are:
	 
2014 Contract Sunshine Proposal
Faculty Association, AFT 6157 Opening Proposal
July 8, 2014
	 
The following represents the opening proposal from the San Jose/Evergreen Federation of Teachers, AFT 6157 (Union) to the District. The Union reserves the right to add, amend, delete or change any of these proposals.
	 
Article 1 Recognition
Change our Name
Add Temporary Faculty Member Side letter
Update Non Credit
	 
Article 4 Additional Faculty Member Rights
Adjunct Centers
Mileage
	 
Article 8 Full-Time Salary, Hire Dates and Seniority Number
Equitable Compensation Adjustments and other Increases for Full time Faculty
Delete Gavilan
Include Side Letter on Categorical Non-Tenured Step Placement   
	 
Article 9 Adjunct Faculty and Substitutes
Equitable Compensation Adjustments and other Increases for Adjunct Faculty
Delete Gavilan
PD Day Pay
Pay for Committee Work
Office Hours
Seniority Rehire Preference –Clarify Language Re Evaluations and Responsibilities including SRP after retirement
Health Benefits-Make Improvements including EAP
Adjunct Bill of Rights
SDI-Include Side Letter in Contract
	 
Article 10 Professional Recognition
Clarify Longevity
Activity Payments
Add fund for Staff Development for Full time and Adjunct Faculty
	 
Article 11 Working Days/Calendars
CNA Position
Calendar for 2017-2018
Reassess Non-Instructional Workload
	 
Article 12 Workload, Class Size, Class Cancellation
Eliminate Cumulative Load
Lecture Lab Parity Science
Revise Class Cancellation Language
Reassess Non-Instructional Workload
	 
Article 13 Leaves of Absence
Incorporate Side Letter re: Computation of Sick Leave Deduction
	 
Article 14 Sabbatical Leave
Improve/Clarify Language            
	 
Article 15 Overload
Revise                 
	 
Article 17 Benefits
Remove Medical Benefit Cap
Improve Life Insurance and Vision Coverage
	 
Article 18 Retirement
Remove Medical Benefit Cap
Add EAP Plan for Bridge Program
	 
Articles 19 Evaluation of Adjunct Faculty 
Update Language
	 
Article 21 and 22 Evaluation of Grant-Funded Non-Tenured Categorical Faculty and Evaluation of Tenured Faculty  
Update language
	 
Article 24 Reduction in Force
Add Health Center Nurses to Disciplines Not Requiring a Master’s Degree and Psychologist requiring Master’s.
Update List as needed
	 
New Article-Safety
	 
Appendix K Eligibility for Professional Recognition
III A, B and C Update to Reflect Article Change numerous years ago
	 
Side Letter re: Athletics Program and Assistant Coach Positions-Add to contract.

items.item_text_raw: 6. 6:10 P.M. Public Hearing On The San Jose/Evergreen Federation of Teachers, AFT 6157 Contract Reopener Proposal With San Jose-Evergreen Community College District 2014-2015

items.item_details:
A public hearing is opened to allow an opportunity for public input regarding the 2014-2015 contract re-opener proposal submitted by the San Jose/Evergreen Community College District at the July 8, 2014, meeting of Board.  The openers are:
	 
Article 4 Additional Faculty Member Rights – District has an interest in updating language associated with pay checks.
	 
Article's 8/9/10 – District has an interest in displaying compensation increments consistently throughout the Agreement.
	 
Article 9 Adjunct Faculty and Substitutes – District has an interest in addressing language associated with SRP, evaluations and step advancement.
	 
Article 10 Professional Recognition - District has an interest in addressing collegiate level courses, the appeals process, the sequencing of the article and others concerning clarifying language.
	 
Article 11 Working Days/Calendar - District has an interest in clarifying 11.5 and adjusting the alternate professional development plan.
	 
Article 12 Workload, Class size, class Cancellation - District has an interest in addressing in on-line teaching, non-instructional assignments, faculty professional responsibilities and office hours.
	 
Article 13 Leaves and Absences - District has an interest in addressing FMLA revisions.
	 
Article 14 Sabbatical Leave - District has an interest in addressing multiple sabbaticals effect on small departments, compensation, and overload or extra work.
	 
Article 15 Overload - District has an interest in addressing overload assignments at home campus, deadlines for using banked overload
	 
Article 16 Transfers - District has an interest in addressing the processes associated with a self-initiated transfer.
	 
Article 19a – 22  Evaluations - District has an interest in addressing in each of these article language that addressees SLO assessment, criteria for evaluation, evaluation process, evaluation for online classes, evaluation committee, evaluation forms and on-line distribution and collection of student surveys.
	 
Article 23 Community Complaints- District has an interest in addressing the processes associated with student complaints and others.
	 
Article 24 – (New) Discipline and Compelling Circumstances - District has an interest in addressing discipline by articulating causes for discipline and the associated processes in its own article.
	 
Article 24 Reduction in Force– Current - District has an interest in renumbering 24 to 25 and clarify Faculty Service Areas and STRS calculation.
	 
Article 25 Day Care– Current – District has an interest in deleting this article because it is no longer relevant.
	 
Article 32 Term – Affirm the length/duration of successor contract.
	 
The District reserves the right to add, amend, delete and/or change any of these proposals.

items.item_details:
A public hearing is opened to allow an opportunity for public input regarding the 2014-2015 contract re-opener proposal submitted by the California School Employees Association at the August 26, 2014, meeting of Board.  The openers are:
	 
Article 6: Salary
CSEA has an interest in a fair and equitable pay increase.
	 
CSEA has an interest in modifying the Campus Police retirement system from CalPERS to CalPERS Safety.
	 
CSEA has an interest to modify Police Officer shift rotation to address the need of shift selection by seniority.
	 
CSEA has an interest to increase the salary for Temporary or Permanent reassignment of a Unit Position with Higher Salary Range.
	 
Article 8:  Work Schedule
CSEA has an interest to add language that would allow for an alternate work schedule during the summer months.
	 
Article 21:  Retirement Benefits
CSEA has an interest in a permanent âBridge Planâ for eligible CSEA bargaining unit members.
	 
Article 23:  Reclassification
CSEA has an interest in adding an appeal process.

items.item_details:
Pursuant to Title V, Section 58301, the Board of Trustees shall hold a public hearing on the proposed budget on or before the 15th day of September.
	 
The District is required to make available the proposed budget for public inspection at least three days prior.  Notification of date and location on the proposed budget shall be published in a newspaper of general circulation in the District.  Accordingly, notice was posted in the San Jose Mercury News on Saturday, August 23, 2014, and the proposed budget was made available to the public for inspection on Thursday, September 4, 2014.
	 
This item is intended to identify the place on the agenda where the public may appear and comment on the proposed budget or any item in the budget.

items.item_details:
1. Position Management
	 
a. Position Establishment
	 
Establishment of Program Assistant, 30.77% FTE, (8HUMA0203C) in the Student Learning Department at Evergreen Valley College effective 09/10/14.
	 
Establishment of Program Assistant, 100% FTE, (7VPSA0207C) in the Student Development and Activities at San Jose City College effective 08/26/14.
	 
	 
2. Employment
	 
a. New Hire
	 
Groundskeeper II, 100% FTE, (7GRDS0208C) in the Grounds Department at San Jose City College effective 08/18/14.
	 
3. Change of Status
	 
a. Promotion
	 
Promotion to Administrative Secretary (8BUSS0214C) in Administrative Services at Evergreen Valley College from Senior Division Administrative Assistant (7BUSC0211C) in Business & Workforce Development at San Jose City College effective 09/15/14.
	 
	 
b. Permanent Increase to Position's Yearly Work Schedule Hours
	 
The employee's position, Traffic & Campus Services Officer (9COPS0221C), work hours are permanently being increased from 11 months per year, 43.26% FTE, 900 hours per year to 11 months per year, 73.08% FTE, 1520 hours per year in the Campus Police Department at the District Office effective 09/03/13.
	 
4. Separation 
	 
Employee separation effective 09/05/14.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustes approve the Classified Personnel Actions as submitted.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.
items.item_text: Hourly, Student Work & Volunteer Personnel Actions
items.item_text_raw: 6. Hourly, Student Work & Volunteer Personnel Actions

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees. Board Policy 6100 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval. All contracts, purchase orders and contract revisions exceeding the current bid limit of $84,100 shall have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
	 
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $1,000, as well as additional contracts, although not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts, purchase orders and contract revisions for the period of July 10, 2014 through August 9, 2014 as noted in the attached documents.
items.item_text: Ratification of Contracts, Purchase Orders and Contract Revisions
items.item_text_raw: 7. Ratification of Contracts, Purchase Orders and Contract Revisions

items.item_details:
The California Community Colleges Chancellor's Office Division of Workforce and Economic Development disseminates funds to community colleges to implement the Faculty Entrepreneurship Mini-Grants by compensating faculty and the college for the creation of courses and programs and related activities that will advance Entrepreneurship and Career Technical Education Programs.  The contract is administered by the Small Business Deputy Sector Navigator Program and Business & Entrepreneurship Center (BEC) Program at Cabrillo College and is intended to support Evergreen Valley College's efforts to build and expand entrepreneurial offerings regionwide.  Evergreen Valley College's application was approved and grant funds awarded in the amount of $19,000.
	 
Cabrillo Community College District is acting as the fiscal agent.  The Faculty Entrepreneurship Mini-Grant Project will allow Evergreen Valley College to receive grant funds not to exceed $19,000 for the period of July 1, 2014 through December 31, 2014.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Faculty Entrepreneurship Mini-Grant Project agreement by and between Cabrillo Community College District (referred to as District) and Evergreen Valley College (referred to as Contractor).
items.item_text: Acceptance of grant funds - Faculty Entrepreneurship Mini-Grant Project

items.item_text: Adoption of the Measure G Bond Programs Consent Agenda
items.item_text_raw: 1. Adoption of the Measure G Bond Programs Consent Agenda

items.item_details:
The Technology Center/Student Center Interior Finish Upgrades Project is part of Project #31304 Scheduled Maintenance. This project will provide the following scope of work for the following buildings at the San Jose City College Campus:
	 
1. Technology Center
                     a. Replace damaged ceiling tiles
b. Replace carpet
c. Repair or replace damaged resilient flooring
d. Replace floor outlet cover plates
	 
2. Student Services Center
                     a. Replace damaged ceiling tiles
b. Replace carpet
c. Repair or replace damaged resilient flooring
d. Replace wall base where carpet or resilient flooring is replaced
e. Replace damaged glass
	 
The project was posted on the District’s purchasing website and advertised in local papers on July 16th and July 23rd. In addition the advertisement was published at local builders’ exchanges and plan rooms. On August 19, 2014 three bid proposals were received for construction as follows:
 
California Plus Engineering:   Non-responsive (did not include bid amount in package)
Pueblo Construction             $ 668,340
R.C. Benson & Sons Inc.      $ 686,000 
 
Pueblo Construction from Seaside, CA was determined to be the lowest responsive bidder in the amount of $668,340. 
It is recommended to award a contract to Pueblo Construction in the amount of $668,340 for the Technology Center/Student Center Interior Finish Upgrades Project.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees award a construction contract to Pueblo Construction, in the amount of $668,340 for the Technology Center/Student Center Interior Finish Upgrades Project at San Jose City College.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Pueblo Construction– Technology Center/Student Center Interior Finish Upgrades Project
items.item_text_raw: 2. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Pueblo Construction– Technology Center/Student Center Interior Finish Upgrades Project

items.item_details:
On July 8, 2014 the Board approved a contract with Bay Area Tree Specialists to provide construction services for the Campus Site Improvements Phase I at the San Jose City College Campus.
	 
Construction contracts often times experience unforeseen conditions, coordination gaps and/or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Bay Area Tree Specialists submitted  pricing proposals for additional work related to public health, safety and general health of the trees.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount              $   54,600.00
Previous Approved Changes         $         00.00
Change Order No. 001                  $     3,320.00
	 
Total Contract and Changes         $    57,920.00
	 
The net change to Bay Area Tree Specialistâs contract as a result of all changes issued will be $3,320 which equates to 6.0% of the base contract. This change will be funded from Project Contingency.  No additional funding is required.

items.item_details:
Due to the timing of Division of the State Architect (DSA) final approval, Guaranteed Maximum Price (GMP) assembly timelines and scheduled Board meetings, the current project schedule is at risk due to the length of time required for these activities.
	 
	 
	 
The ordering, fabrication and erection of structural steel for the Automotive Technology Building Project at Evergreen Valley College (EVC) is part of the project critical path (driving the project schedule).  The project team has identified the early release of structural steel detailing as an effective approach to protect the project schedule, and to help the project recover from the lengthy delays caused by DSA during the project approval process.  If the Board approves this approach, the contractor (C. Overaa & Co.) will be authorized to contract for detailing services specifically related to structural steel for the Automotive Technology project.  This will be a change to the C. Overaa & Co. Pre-Construction Services Agreement, and is expected to protect approximately four weeks on the project schedule.  It is important to note that the ordering of steel members, the fabrication and the erection scopes of work will remain uncommitted until such time as the Board approves the GMP (anticipated to be its October 14, 2014 meeting).
	 
Original Contract Amount                     $     45,848
Previous Change Order(s)                   $              0
Change Order No. 001                         $   106,375
	 
Revised Contract Amount                    $    152,223
	 
Please note that the agreement with Overaa is a services agreement.  As such it is not subject to the restrictions of the Public Contract Code that applies to works of construction.
	 
All Pre-Construction Services Agreement dates remain as per the original agreement.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 001 to the Pre-Construction Services Agreement with C. Overaa & Co., in the amount of $106,375 for the release of structural steel detailing in an effort to mitigate the amount of time required for the order and delivery of structural steel to construct the Automotive Technology Building Project at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Project #32111 – C. Overaa & Co., Change Order No. 001
items.item_text_raw: 4. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Project #32111 – C. Overaa & Co., Change Order No. 001

items.item_details:
The District engaged a furniture consultant (KRJ) to perform a detailed study of the existing furniture to determine; user needs, functionality, condition and sustainability for use in the New District Office.   A detailed furniture inventory was generated and reviewed by the District; the resulting requirements for new furniture were put out for public bid.
	 
The public bidding process for vendors was conducted between August 6, 2014 and August 21, 2014.  The project was advertised in local papers on August 6th, August 19th and published at local buildersâ€™ exchanges and plan rooms.  In addition, invitations to bid were sent to over 15 vendors.  Bids were opened at 3:00 pm on August 21, 2014.    
	 
There were 7 bidders total and a robust turnout of small, minority and disadvantaged business.  Final selections and quantities of some furniture items are ongoing, which will likely result in savings to the amounts below. Based on the evaluation of bid unit prices for specific new furniture products and required documentation, it is recommended that the vendors listed below be awarded contracts not-to-exceed the amount noted.
	 
Jones-Campbell (SBE)                                              $  136,280.00
In2Change (SBE)                                                      $    38,797.00
Contract Office Group (MBH)                                    $    31,034.00
Palace (SBE)                                                             $    19,886.00
Mity-Lite                                                                     $    17,604.00
Staples                                                                       $    18,439.00
	 
Total Cost:                                                                 $ 262,040.00
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the award of contracts not-to-exceed the amounts indicated, to the following furniture vendors: Jones-Campbell ($136,280), In2Change ($38,797), Contract Office Group ($31,034), Palace ($19,886), Mity-Lite ($17,604), Staples ($18,439). The total amount of all contracts awarded will be $262,040.00.

items.item_details: In October, 2013 the Board approved a contract to TMAD Taylor and Gaines (TTG) for assessment and design programming to relocate the main data facility (MDF) at Evergreen Valley College (EVC) out of the Roble building to elsewhere on campus.  As part of that scope of work, TTG presented an initial report regarding its findings related to the MDF and the EVC data infrastructure.  After that meeting, and based on TTGâs findings, ITSS felt sufficient data had been provided to allow a reduction in the TTG scope of work.  After negotiation with TTG, the reduced scope and cost were agreed between the District and TTG, resulting in Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) Revision 001 in the amount of (-$41,500).  The final total cost of the TTG PAA will then be $168,500.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Revision No. 001 in the amount of (-$41,500) (deductive) to the TMAD Taylor and Gaines Project Assignment Amendment EVC-01 for Technology Consulting Services.

items.item_details:
On December 10, 2013, the Board agreed to enter into a contract with Galeb Paving, Inc. to provide construction services for parking lots & street maintenance project at Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Campus.  The scope of work included the first phase of a northern loop road to connect the east and west EVC parking lots and provide pavement marking for curbs of parking lots 1, 1A, 2, 3, 6, 7, 8 and select portions of Paseo de Arboles Road. 
	 
Change Order No. 004 addresses repair and replace of existing damaged asphaltic paving at the entrance to Lot 4 directed by the college.
	 
Galeb Paving, Inc. submitted written pricing proposals for changes detailed in the Agenda attachment that include additional or deleted materials, equipment, labor, time extensions as applicable and the prescribed mark-ups.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
The one item in this change order results in an ADD to the contract of $2,600.00.
	 
Original Contract Amount              $756,000.00
Previous Approved Changes           $71,818.00
Change Order No. 004                      $2,600.00 (discretionary change directed by EVC)
Total Contract and Changes         $ 830,418.00
	 
The total of Change Orders 1 and 2 to Galeb’s contract (work that was the result of design and field conditions) is $11,967.00, which equates to 1.58% of the base contract.  The total of Change Orders 3 and 4 (work that was discretionary) is $62,451.00.  The total of all changes (Change Orders 1 through 4) is $74,418 and equates to 9.8% of the base contract.
	 
	 
The Substantial Completion Date remains unchanged at August 31, 2014.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 004 for Galeb Paving, Inc. in amount of $2,600.00 for the Parking Lots & Street Maintenance Project at Evergreen Valley College.

items.item_details:
The District engaged a furniture consultant (KRJ) to perform a detailed study of the existing furniture to determine: user needs, functionality, condition and suitability for use in the New District Office.  A detailed existing furniture inventory was generated and reviewed by the District, the resulting requirements for relocation of existing furniture, and all District Office contents, were put out for public bid.
	 
The public bidding process for vendors was conducted between August 8, 2014 and August 25, 2014.  The project was advertised in local papers on August 8th, August 15th and published at local builders exchanges and plan rooms.  In addition, invitations to bid were sent to over 12 vendors. Bids were opened at 3:00 pm on August 25, 2014. There were 3 bidders total, as follows:
  
Moving Solutions (SBE)                                             $ 27,144.00
Crown Worldwide (Other)                                          $ 28,666.00
Nor-Cal Moving (Other)                                              $ 45,745.00
	 
Based on the evaluation of the bid proposals and required documentation, it was determined that Moving Solutions was the lowest responsible bidder. Therefore it is recommended to award a contract to Moving Solutions in the amount of $27,144.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve issuance of a contract to Moving Solutions in the amount of $27,144.00 for the SJECCD New District Office Project (#39301)

On June 10, 2014, the Board approved a Contract to JKL Construction Services, Inc. in the amount of $306,224, for the Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Mechanical Electrical and Plumbing Upgrade Package-2, Project #32307-06.  The project encompasses approximately 60 upgrades and repairs in the LETC, Gullo-1, PE, and Sequoia buildings.  The work also includes changes to the buildings required by the Division of State Architect.
	 
Construction contracts often times experience unforeseen conditions, coordination gaps and/or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract price in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 001 includes changes for replacement of heating and cooling water valves in the PE building and modifications to existing HVAC control wiring sequences to accommodate newly installed Fan Coil Units.  
	 
JKL Construction Services, Inc. submitted written pricing proposals for changes detailed in the Agenda attachment that include additional or deleted materials, equipment, labor and the prescribed mark-ups.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.

items.item_details:
This contract is for the installation and configuration of network equipment for the new District Office (40 S. Market Street) per the Network Infrastructure Upgrade Project (#39705) created on 11/12/13.
 
Dasher will provide technical assistance and implementation services for the network deployment at the new District Office per the attached Dasher Technologies ICA and Statement of Work (Revision -002, 08-20-2014) pursuant to RFP # G2010.0099 and the Master Agreement with Dasher Technologies approved by the board on 8/26/14. The scope of the work includes the following: 
Choosing, sizing and ordering the network devices
Receiving, unpackaging
Physical setup
Logical configuration
Integration into existing network
Validation of Ethernet connectivity and services
Orientation/Knowledge transfer
Dasher will work with the technical contacts at SJECCD to confirm that all physical space (rack, power, cabling) is available for the new network equipment. 
	 
The installation services are not to exceed $120,000 and the network and data center equipment is not to exceed $905,000.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve District Office Network Infrastructure Installation and Migration Services Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) and the purchase of District Office network equipment based on RFP # G2010.0099 and pursuant to the Master Agreement with Dasher Technologies approved by the board on 8/26/14 (Measure G -2010 Bond Program).
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: District Office Network Infrastructure Installation and Migration Services Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) with Dasher Technologies and the Purchase of District Office Network Equipment according to RFP # G200099.
items.item_text_raw: 10. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: District Office Network Infrastructure Installation and Migration Services Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) with Dasher Technologies and the Purchase of District Office Network Equipment according to RFP # G2010.0099.

items.item_details:
To support the sustainability effort during the design and construction of the Physical Education Building located at SJCC, it is necessary to secure commissioning services related to mechanical and electrical and other systems.  This is a requirement to obtain LEED Silver Certification as directed by the District for new building construction.   
	 
The District issued a Request for Proposal (RFP) to multiple vendors as part of their outreach and received proposals from six firms, one determined to be non-responsive. The submittals received were as follows: 
	 
FIRM:                                        PRICE:                 RANK:
	 
Alpha Tech                               $44,000                  1
Eichler Associates                  $54,000                  2
TMCx                                        $58,000                  3
Guttmann & Blaevot                $86,000                  4
Interface Engineering              $91,870                  5
Kitchell                                      $59,140                  Non-responsive
	 
	 
The respondents’ proposals were reviewed against the requirements set forth in the RFP and ranked according to best value. The final selection was made by a selection committee consisting of representatives from San Jose’ Evergreen Community College District. The committee selected Alfa Tech Consulting Engineers, representing the best overall value for Price, Technical Expertise and references.
	 
It is recommended that the Board award a contract to AlphaTech for the Commissioning Services for the San Jose City College Physical Education Building Project #122.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve an Agreement with Alfa Tech Consulting Engineers, Inc. for Commissioning Services in the amount of $44,500 for the Physical Education Building at San Jose City College Project #122.

ADOPTION OF THE FISCAL YEAR 2014/2015 BUDGET
	 
The San Jose/Evergreen Community College District's proposed Adopted Budget for Fiscal Year 2014/2015 is included as part of this item.  The California Community College Chancellor's Office requires the District's Board of Trustees to approve the adopted budget by September 15, 2014.  The District Budget Committee has reviewed this budget and the underlying budget assumptions.
	 
The Adopted Budget is provided as an attachment to this item and also can be accessed on the District's web site.

items.item_details:
This is a short, informative, joint presentation by the AFFIRM and UMOJA programs on their recent trip to Belize, presented by SJECCD students: Christine Tellez and Derrick Newton, and SJECCD professors: Khalid White and Flora Payne.
	 
The intent of our short term Study Abroad trip to Belize was multi-faceted.  As educators at Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City College, our principle goal, and subsequent achievement, was to broaden our students' understanding of how U.S. History, current day culture and current socioeconomic realities are interrelated with the lives of the indigenous Mayan, Latin American, Creole and Garifuna people that comprise Belizean society specifically, and Latin American and Caribbean societies more broadly.  Through wide-ranging and in-depth study of the cultural, political and economic life of Belize, we provided our students, in microcosm, a view of the interrelationship between Latin American, Caribbean and North American society. We intended for our students to come away from their study abroad experience seeing themselves as participants in a diverse and multicultural global society.
items.item_text: Presentation by Affirm and Umoja Trip to Belize
items.item_text_raw: 1. Presentation by Affirm and Umoja Trip to Belize

items.item_details:
INTRODUCTION
	 
Since March 2012, A. Plescia & Co., Gruen Gruen + Associates, Eller & Associates and staff with the San Jose Evergreen Community College District (the âteamâ), have completed market research, real estate financial analysis, land use planning and policy review and obtained consensus from the Board of Trustees of the San Jose Evergreen Community District on guiding principles for the disposition and development of an approximately 27-acre site adjoining Evergreen Valley College identified as not needed for the operations of the College. The team conducted meetings with a sub-committee of the Board of Trustees formed in order to review alternative property disposition and entitlement approaches and to review and approve the solicitation materials and process. Meetings were also held with the full Board of Trustees, which approved the issuance of the Request for Proposals.  
	 
Pre-proposal meetings were held with potential respondents. Four proposals were ultimately received. An initial report was prepared that described the proposed developments, business terms/conditions, present value of proposed ground rents, and advantages and disadvantages of each proposal. The team conducted discussions with the respondents and briefed the sub-committee on the evaluation of the proposals.
	 
At the direction of the sub-committee, the team conducted meetings with the development teams regarding requested clarifying/additional information about their respective proposals. Based on the additional information, an updated proposal evaluation report was prepared and a closed session meeting with the full Board of Trustees was held on August 26th to discuss status of the land development project, respond to Trustee questions, and discuss next steps.  
	 
PURPOSE 
	 
In light of the policy direction, the purpose of the meeting on September 9, 2014 is to provide an update of the process to date, discuss any questions Trustees may have, and to describe the anticipated next steps to carry out the objectives of the disposition and development initiative to accomplish the goals of the Board of Trustees, including generating revenue to advance the educational mission of the District.
